definitions.text: the property of being rigid and resistant to pressure; not easily scratched; measured on Mohs scale
a quality of water that contains dissolved mineral salts that prevent soap from lathering
examples: the costs of reducing hardness depend on the relative amounts of calcium and magnesium compounds that are present

definitions.text: devoid of passion or feeling; hardheartedness
the quality of being difficult to do
examples: he assigned a series of problems of increasing hardness
the ruggedness of his exams caused half the class to fail
the harshness of his punishment was inhuman
